posts._title: Juan A. Gamero – Vivir la utopía AKA Living Utopia (1997)
posts.title: Vivir la utopía
posts.excerpt: Quote:“Living Utopia is a unique documentary that blends the historical account of the origins and development of the Spanish anarchist movement, focussing on the 1936 war. A reflection on the philosophical underpinnings of such a movement and their practical application. As both an informative and inspiring piece of research it is considered a jewel amongst …

posts.title: Hospital
posts.excerpt: Quote:This 1970 Frederick Wiseman documentary was a 1994 National Film Registry selection by the National Film Preservation Board. In 1970, the 84-minute film won two Emmys-“Best News Documentary” and “Best Director.” Wiseman looked at life in a large urban hospital, detailing daily activities with his main focus on the emergency ward and outpatient clinic. Medical …

posts._title: Werner W. Wallroth – Blutsbrüder AKA Blood Brothers (1975)
posts.title: Blutsbrüder
posts.excerpt: Blood Brothers (German: Blutsbrüder) is a 1975 East German western film directed by Werner W. Wallroth and starring Dean Reed, Gojko Mitic and Gisela Freudenberg. The film’s sets were designed by the art directors Heinz Röske and Marlene Willmann. It was made by the state-controlled DEFA company. PLOT:Harmonika, an American deserter, is captured by a …

posts.title: O Anjo Nasceu
posts.excerpt: Julio Bressane wrote:“When I made O Anjo Nasceu I thought I had made my most difficult film, a completely irresponsible film, that space, that vacuum, that nothing. It was a devastating experience for me, a shock. Much, much more than Matou a Família e Foi ao Cinema, which was a well-received film. I think O …

posts._title: Philippe de Broca – Les jeux de l’amour AKA The Love Game (1960)
posts.title: Les jeux de l’amour
posts.excerpt: Victor takes life lightly. Jolly and offhand, he has been a very pleasant companion to Suzanne for two years now. Suzanne wants to marry Victor and have children with him. Victor on the other hand isn’t interested in becoming a husband or a father. While he cannot be bothered into complying with her wishes, their …

posts.title: Mad Hot Ballroom
posts.excerpt: The students of several New York City elementary schools learn ballroom dancing and compete in a city wide dance competition.

posts._title: Lynne Sachs – Still Life with Woman and Four Objects (1986)
posts.title: Still Life with Woman and Four Objects
posts.excerpt: The film portrait falls somewhere between a painting and a prose poem. Sachs looks at a fictional woman’s daily routines and thoughts. By interweaving threads of history and fiction, the film becomes a tribute to a real woman: Emma Goldman.

posts.title: Man Made Monster
posts.excerpt: A mad scientist turns a man into an electrically-controlled monster to do his bidding.

posts.title: Lek wysokosci
posts.excerpt: Father-to-be Marcin reaches out to his estranged schizophrenic father in search for love and understanding.

posts._title: Michel Boisrond – Le chemin des écoliers AKA Way of Youth (1959)
posts.title: Le chemin des écoliers
posts.excerpt: Synopsis:Paris, 1943. With the country still under Nazi occupation and commodities severely rationed, ordinary French people muddle through as best they can. Charles Michaud is a law-abiding man of impeccable morals who becomes duly anxious when he finds that his 17-year-old son Antoine has been regularly absconding from school.
